column4: Microsoft asks U.S. to let it disclose security requests
column5: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp said on Tuesday it has written to the U.S. Attorney General to ask for more freedom to disclose how it handles requests for customer data from national security organizations.

column4: UPDATE 1-Secret court sides with Yahoo  orders U.S. to declassify Prism surveillance ruling
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  July 16 A secret U.S. court overseeing government domestic surveillance activities has sided with Yahoo Inc and ordered the Obama administration to declassify and publish a 2008 court decision justifying Prism  the data collection program revealed last month by former security contractor Edward Snowden.

column4: UPDATE 1-Microsoft asks U.S. to let it disclose security requests
column5: SEATTLE  July 16 Microsoft Corp said on Tuesday it has written to the U.S. Attorney General to ask for more freedom to disclose how it handles requests for customer data from national security  organizations.

column4: Microsoft asks US government for freedom to disclose security requests
column5: SEATTLE  July 16 Microsoft Corp said on Tuesday it has written to the U.S. Attorney General to ask for more freedom to disclose how it handles requests from national security organizations for customer data.

column4: Mylan says court dismisses some of Teva's patent claims on MS drug
column5: A federal court in New York ruled that Mylan Inc's generic application for a multiple sclerosis drug has not infringed some of Teva Pharmaceutical Industries' patents  Mylan said.

column4: Mylan says court dismisses some of Teva's patent claims on MS drug
column5: July 16 A federal court in New York ruled that Mylan Inc's  generic application for a multiple sclerosis drug has not infringed some of Teva Pharmaceutical Industries'  patents  Mylan said.

column4: First Manhattan sues Vivus for shareholder meeting delay
column5: A proxy battle between Vivus Inc and First Manhattan Co  its top investor  intensified on Tuesday when FMC filed a lawsuit saying the directors of the obesity drugmaker illegally delayed its shareholder meeting to keep themselves in office.

column4: UPDATE 3-First Manhattan sues Vivus for shareholder meeting delay
column5: July 16 A proxy battle between Vivus Inc  and First Manhattan Co  its top investor  intensified on Tuesday when FMC filed a lawsuit saying the directors of the obesity drugmaker illegally delayed its shareholder meeting to keep themselves in office.

column4: First Manhattan sues Vivus for delaying shareholder meet
column5: July 16 Obesity drug maker Vivus Inc's  proxy battle with its top investor intensified on Tuesday with First Manhattan Co (FMC) filing a lawsuit alleging that Vivus's directors illegally delayed the company's shareholder meeting to keep themselves in office.

column4: Zagg slashes full-year sales forecast again; shares slide
column5: Zagg Inc   which makes scratch guards for mobile and tablet devices  slashed its full-year sales forecast again  citing lack of major mobile device launches.

column4: EMERGING MARKETS-Mexico stocks fall on America Movil dividend payment
column5: * Investors sell telecom stocks after receiving dividend     * Mexico's IPC index down 1.64 pct  Brazil's Bovespa flat       SAO PAULO/MEXICO CITY July 16 Mexican stocks slid on Tuesday as investors sold off shares of telecommunications giant America Movil  Latin America's biggest phone company  after it paid a dividend to shareholders.     Brazil's Bovespa index  which had lost more than 20 percent of its value between late May and July 8  rose slightly to post a gain for the fourth

column4: Mexico stocks fall over 1 pct as America Movil  Televisa weigh
column5: MEXICO CITY  July 16 Mexico's IPC stock index fell more than 1 percent on Tuesday  as telecoms giant America Movil  controlled by Mexican mogul Carlos Slim  and media behemoth Televisa weighed.

column4: Bernanke must defend actions in AIG bailout case -Greenberg's Starr
column5: July 16 Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke was the final authority on the "punitive" 2008 bailout of American International Group Inc and should testify about how and why it happened  a company run by the insurer's former chief executive said.

column4: AT&T follows T-Mobile US with more frequent device upgrades
column5: NEW YORK AT&T Inc customers will be able to upgrade phones once a year instead of waiting two years under a new option that involves monthly device payments as AT&T defends itself against challenges from T-Mobile US.

column4: UPDATE 2-AT&T follows T-Mobile US with more frequent device upgrades
column5: NEW YORK  July 16 AT&T Inc customers will be able to upgrade phones once a year instead of waiting two years under a new option that involves monthly device payments as AT&T defends itself against challenges from T-Mobile US .

column4: AT&T follows T-Mobile US with more frequent device upgrades
column5: NEW YORK AT&T Inc  said on Tuesday that it plans to allow its customers to make annual device upgrades and pay via monthly installment plans to compete with a similar option from smaller rival T-Mobile US .

column4: AT&T follows T-Mobile US with more frequent device upgrades
column5: NEW YORK  July 16 AT&T Inc said on Tuesday it plans to allow its customers to make annual device upgrades and pay via monthly installment plans to compete with a similar option by smaller rival T-Mobile US.

column5: * FTSE 100 ends down 0.5 percent after late selloff     * Standard Chartered hit by cut in India short-term rates     * Mining sector gets fillip from Rio's China view     * HSBC flags Rio  BHP Billiton as sector picks     * For more on individual stock moves see       By Simon Jessop     LONDON  July 16 Mining heavyweight Rio Tinto helped limit a slide in Britain's blue-chip FTSE 100  index on Tuesday with a production update that assuaged some concern about Chinese demand.     Rio

column4: UPDATE 2-UK Dreamliner fire probe looks at several components
column5: LONDON/WASHINGTON British investigators said on Tuesday said they were looking at a number of components  including a transmitter made by U.S. firm Honeywell  as they searched for the source of a fire on a Boeing 787 Dreamliner in London last week.

column4: UK Dreamliner fire probe confirms looking at Honeywell part
column5: LONDON British investigators said on Tuesday a transmitter made by U.S. firm Honeywell was one of several components that may have caused a fire on a Boeing Dreamliner in London last week. |Â Video

column4: Honeywell asked to join UK Dreamliner fire probe-AAIB
column5: LONDON  July 16 U.S. conglomerate Honeywell  has been invited to join the investigation into the fire that broke out aboard one of Boeing's 787 Dreamliner jets last week  Britain's Air Accident Investigation Branch (AAIB) said on Tuesday.

column4: Battery in Honeywell locator eyed in 787 fire: source
column5: WASHINGTON Investigators are looking into whether a fire on a Boeing  Dreamliner in London last week was caused by the battery of an emergency locator transmitter built by Honeywell International Inc   according to a source familiar with the probe.

column4: WRAPUP 3-Battery in Honeywell locator eyed in 787 fire-source
column5: WASHINGTON  July 15 Investigators are looking into whether a fire on a Boeing Dreamliner in London last week was caused by the battery of an emergency locator transmitter built by Honeywell International Inc  according to a source familiar with the probe.

column4: ConocoPhillips to pay BP  Exxon for Alaska pipeline costs
column5: ANCHORAGE  Alaska ConocoPhillips  Alaska's top-volume oil producer  will pay about $264 million to BP Plc to help cover the cost of transporting crude through the Trans Alaska Pipeline (TAPS)  under a settlement approved on Tuesday by federal officials.

column4: ConocoPhillips to pay BP  Exxon for Alaska pipeline costs

Goldman's Value-at-Risk in commodities stood at $19 million per day in the second quarter  down $2 million from the first quarter and $1 million lower than a year earlier. VaR is a measure of the maximum amount of money a bank is prepared to lose in a day from trading a par
